description: Ground breaking post-war reinforced concrete building with cavernous interior. Sweeping roof structure with a clear single span of 194 feet, the lack of internal columns making best use of space. Opening by kind permission of Go-Ahead.

factsheet.heading: Stockwell Garage's history
paragraphs: Stockwell Garage opened on Wednesday 2 April 1952. Designed by London Transport’s own team, in partnership with Adie Button and Partners, the building cost £450,000 (an estimated £14million in 2022) and its main feature is a spectacular reinforced concrete barrel-vaulted roof, 392 feet long by 194 feet wide. At the time it was the largest unsupported area under one roof in Europe and as a result there is an uninterrupted floor space of 73,350 square feet – enough to accommodate 200 buses.

The building was granted Grade II* listed status in 1988, reflecting its post-war architecture and engineering importance and it remains the only operational bus garage in the country with such a status. Writer and local resident Will Self said of Stockwell Garage in 2007: “It’s a lovely building – sinuous, curved, organic. I could live in it for a year”.

Visitors often gaze up and marvel at the cathedral like attributes of this amazing facility. A building designed to the highest standards of the day to carry out an everyday function – providing a roof over a fleet of buses.

185 buses are based at Stockwell Garage today. The majority are double-deck, and the large maintenance facility (there are ten pits) also acts as a service centre for other Go-Ahead London garages. Stockwell is a big local employer, with over 600 personnel. The majority are drivers, along with engineers, administrators, supervisors, service controllers and managers. The garage is open 24 hours a day, 364 days a year.
See 'Guided tour information' for full details of the tours.

factsheet.heading: Guided tour information
paragraphs: A unique opportunity to be guided around Stockwell Bus Garage and learn more about its rich history and see the current operation - with behind the scenes access.
As part of Open House, we are offering guided tours of Stockwell Garage on Sunday 18 September. The tours will run hourly, from 10:00 until 15:00, and last approximately 40 minutes.

As part of the tour: be guided through the Operating building, including a visit to the service control room, see the extensive engineering area and iconic roof and, learn more about what makes Stockwell Garage so special.
Meeting point on Binfield Road outside main garage entrance (in front of garage sign). Please arrive 5 minutes prior to the tour start time and have confirmation of booking to hand (no need to print)
Please ensure you follow the safety advice given by the guide and remain with the group at all times during the tour.
